datafield.subfield: al-Juzʼ al-thānī min Kitāb al-Rawḍ al-fāʼiq al-maʻrūf bi-al-Ḥurayfīsh,
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 519
Origin: Lacks dated colophon but may be 15th century as suggested by paper.
Accompanying materials: a. Inventory cataloguing slips in hand of Winifred Smeaton Thomas. -- b. Acquisitions slip from Yahuda.
Former shelfmark: From inner front cover and spine label, "IL151" (likely supplied by Yahuda, see acquisitions slip).

Binding: Pasteboards covered in burnished and colored paper ; Type II binding (once with flap, though now missing) ; resewn ; endbands lacking ; in poor condition with much wear and abrasion ; some moisture damage ; boards delaminating ; numerous leather repairs ; lower cover detaching at spine ; entire flap missing ; housed in box for protection.

Support: non-European laid paper ; chain lines running horizontally appear to be grouped in threes with roughly 11-12 mm. between the chain lines and roughly 45 mm. between groups ; laid lines running vertically with roughly 8 laid lines per cm. ; rather thick and burnished ; a number of leaves are delaminating.
Decoration: Textual dividers in the form of inverted commas in red ; text rubricated with section headings, subsection headings, keywords, etc. in red.

Script: Naskh ; fine Syrian or Egyptian hand ; sans serif ; alif maqṣūrah is often with dots ; freely ligatured with lām and alif almost always joined from above (looking like inverted "U") and dāl and rāʼ joined to following hāʼ; bar of kāf often missing ; alif of قال often arches over qāf supplying otherwise absent pointing ; swooping final nūn looking more like elongated rāʼ ; occasional vocalization without consistency.
Layout: Written in 13 lines per page ; frame-ruled.

Collation: V-1 (9), V(19), V-4 (25), 5 V(75), VI(87), 4 V(127), 2 VI(151), 2 V(171), V-8 (173), 3 V(203), IV(211), 6 V(271), V-1 (280), IV-6 (282) ; chiefly quinions, though several irregular quires and missing leaves ; Hindu-Arabic numerals appearing near the beginning of each quire seem to provide quire numbering ; catchwords present, though occasionally cut off or missing ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during cataloguing.

Explicit: " اخواني ان الله تعالى ارحم والطف ما يكون بعبده اذا نزل في لحده ووضع خشن التراب على لين خده وجفاه من كان يرغب في قربه ووده فاذا وضع الميت على المغتسل وجرد من اثوابه وايس من أحبابه فينادي واسوتاه [واسوأتاه] وافضيحتاه ولا يسمع نداه غير مولاه"

Incipit: "الفصل الثامن والعشرون في مناقب الفقهاء رضي الله عنهم اجمعين الحمد لله المعروف بالقدم قبل وجود الوجود الموصوف بالكرم والفضل والجود المنزه في وحدانيته عن الابنا والابآء والجدود المقدس عن الصاحبة والمصحوب والوالد والمولود"

Early copy of the second part of a work of pious devotions (anecdotes of holy men, homilies, traditions, etc.) attributed to the popular saint al-Ḥurayfīsh. End wanting. Description provided by Maxim Romanov.
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

A few study/reading notes appear on fol.1a (p.1) ; an almond shaped seal impression appears on interior of upper cover (inscription illegible) ; a few ownership statements appear on fol.1a (p.1) ; fairly clean copy with very few marginal corrections or ammendments.
الجزء الثاني من كتاب الروض الفائق المعروف بالحريفيش,
